intro: Phacelia dubia var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its rapid growth and ability to attract pollinators make it an important plant in ecological restoration projects.
